stories.text:
My understanding of geological drainage basins is that if a drop of rain lands at a specific location of the earth's surface, it's generally possible to determine where that droplet will eventually pool with other water from the same area.

Does a similar (perhaps probabilistic) concept exist within finance/economics?
stories.title: Ask HN: Do 'economic drainage basins' exist?
Alchemy Commerce Reportedly Fires Entire Ukrainian QA Team Without Warning
Mariupol's devastation: AP journalists document war's toll
Pancreatic Tissue from Stem Cells? Sort Of
President Zelenskyy deepfake asks Ukrainians to ‘lay down arms’

stories.text:
Hi friends,

*Context*:

- In 5 years made the transition from Customer Service -> Business Analyst -> BI Developer -> Data Engineer (2m ago);

- Plan to stay on DE job at least for 2 years;

- Would like to land on a malware analyst (reversing) position eventually;

- Since there is a huge skill gap, I'm seeking jobs that bridge the gap

*Research*:

- I'm a self starter but I'm much more persistent when learning on current job and for next job (when some skills can transfer). Thus it's beneficial to find a series of jobs instead of just teaching myself;

- Malware analyst needs the following skills: Sys programming, Reading assembly, Using decompiler, Know OS internals, etc. None is needed as a DE.

- Possible bridge jobs: DE -> DevOps (more Linux, maybe a bit of security) -> Cyber Security analyst -> Malware analyst

*Question*:

What is your recommendation? I'm very curious if anyone actually walked similar roads, maybe not from a DE, but from similar positions.

Thanks in advance~~
stories.title: Ask HN: Viable bridge jobs from data engineer to malware reverser
What 'Americans' think the US should be doing about Russia's Invasion of Ukraine
Instacart: A New Brand Identity to Reflect a New Ambition
